body_html:
@peterjc123 I don't use VM. I use PyTorch directly on my laptop. But I give up installing it on Windows.
It is so frustrating and takes many hours to resolve problems and trying to compiling from source. Easier solution was to install Debian as another OS on my laptop. There works at least PyTorch for CPU. Only inconvenience is that my GeForce 310m is compatible only with CUDA 6.5 and minimal CUDA requirement is 8.0 (for compiling from source it is 7.0).

Do you think if I get it work on Windows will it work with my old GeForce 310m? Because there I have CUDA 9.2 installed.
